verses.text: \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I \w cry|strong="H7121"\w* unto thee: make \w haste|strong="H2363"\w* unto me; give \w ear|strong="H0238"\w* unto my \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*, when I \w cry|strong="H7121"\w* unto thee.

Let my \w prayer|strong="H8605"\w* be set \w forth|strong="H3559"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* thee \add as\add* \w incense|strong="H7004"\w*; \add and\add* the lifting \w up|strong="H4864"\w* of my \w hands|strong="H3709"\w* \add as\add* the \w evening|strong="H6153"\w* \w sacrifice|strong="H4503"\w*.\f + \fr 141.2 \ft set…: Heb. directed\f*

\w Set|strong="H7896"\w* a \w watch|strong="H8108"\w*, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, before my \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*; \w keep|strong="H5341"\w* the \w door|strong="H1817"\w* of my \w lips|strong="H8193"\w*.

\w Incline|strong="H5186"\w* not my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* to \add any\add* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*, to \w practise|strong="H5953"\w* \w wicked|strong="H7562"\w* \w works|strong="H5949"\w* with \w men|strong="H0376"\w* that \w work|strong="H6466"\w* \w iniquity|strong="H0205"\w*: and let me not \w eat|strong="H3898"\w* of their \w dainties|strong="H4516"\w*.

Let the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w* \w smite|strong="H1986"\w* me; \add it shall be\add* a \w kindness|strong="H2617"\w*: and let him \w reprove|strong="H3198"\w* me; \add it shall be\add* an \w excellent|strong="H7218"\w* \w oil|strong="H8081"\w*, \add which\add* shall not \w break|strong="H5106"\w* my \w head|strong="H7218"\w*: for yet my \w prayer|strong="H8605"\w* also \add shall be\add* in their \w calamities|strong="H7451"\w*.\f + \fr 141.5 \ft me; it shall be a…: or, me kindly, and reprove me; let not their precious oil break, etc\f*

When their \w judges|strong="H8199"\w* are \w overthrown|strong="H8058"\w* in \w stony|strong="H5553"\w* \w places|strong="H3027"\w*, they shall \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* my \w words|strong="H0561"\w*; for they are \w sweet|strong="H5276"\w*.

Our \w bones|strong="H6106"\w* are \w scattered|strong="H6340"\w* at the \w grave’s|strong="H7585"\w* \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*, as when one \w cutteth|strong="H6398"\w* and \w cleaveth|strong="H1234"\w* \add wood\add* upon the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*.

But mine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* \add are\add* unto thee, O \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w*: in thee is my \w trust|strong="H2620"\w*; \w leave|strong="H6168"\w* not my \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* \w destitute|strong="H6168"\w*.\f + \fr 141.8 \ft leave…: Heb. make not my soul bare\f*

\w Keep|strong="H8104"\w* me from the \w snares|strong="H3027"\w* \add which\add* they have \w laid|strong="H3369"\w* for me, and the \w gins|strong="H4170"\w* of the \w workers|strong="H6466"\w* of \w iniquity|strong="H0205"\w*.

Let the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* into their own \w nets|strong="H4364"\w*, whilst that I \w withal|strong="H3162"\w* \w escape|strong="H5674"\w*.\f + \fr 141.10 \ft escape: Heb. pass over\f*
